history.content:
The Na Ji lab at Berkeley is imaging the brains of mice navigating tasks in a VR environment to study how hippocampal neurons code, store and replay spatial memory. They are looking for people with experience in Arduino or hardware/software control who would be interested in working on the project with a small team during the summer and/or school year. The team will use Arduino to create electronic systems and collect data, and the expected time commitment is 16+ hours a week.

If you would be interested in interning for the Na Ji lab, please email me your resume and a description of your expected time availability during this summer and the upcoming school year at katheryn.zhou@berkeley.edu. Thank you!
history.subject: Research Opportunity at the Na Ji Neuroscience lab at Berkeley during the summer and/or school year
